document.docAuthor: Haddad, Charles R. & Marusik, Yuri M.
document.masterDocTitle: Clarifying the taxonomic status and distributions of the spider species collected during the Leonhard Schultze expeditions in western and central southern Africa (Arachnida: Araneae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Clarifying the taxonomic status and distributions of the spider species collected during the Leonhard Schultze expeditions in western and central southern Africa (Arachnida: Araneae)

subSubSection.paragraph: Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Lüderitz Bay, Great Namaqualand [Nam].

Asemesthes aureus Purcell, 1908: 242
[D] [jun. syn. of
Asemesthes subnubilus Simon, 1887
]
Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Kamaggas and Steinkopf, Little Namaqualand [ RSA ].

Remark: From information in the WSC it is not clear which author synonymized
A. aureus
with
A. subnubilis
, as the most recent taxonomic treatment (Tucker 1923) still treated them as separate species, even though adults of
A. subnubilis
( type species of
Asemesthes Simon, 1887
) have never been described.
Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Kamaggas, Little Namaqualand [ RSA ]; possibly including juveniles from Lüderitz Bay, Great Namaqualand [Nam].
Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Lüderitz Bay and Prince of Wales Bay, Great Namaqualand [Nam].
Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Rooibank, Southern Hereroland and Otjimbingwe, Southern Hereroland [Nam]. Distribution in WSC: RSA .
Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Kamaggas, Little Namaqualand [ RSA ].
Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Kamaggas and Steinkopf, Little Namaqualand [ RSA ].
Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Between Khakhea and Kang, Kalahari, Bechuanaland [Bot].

Remarks: Tucker, 1923: 275 erroneously referred to 1♁, 2♀ and juv. specimens from Poortjiesfontein, near Hanover as the types (# 14496 in the Iziko South African Museum). The species was described by Purcell (1908) from a single female specimen from the locality listed above.
Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Between Khakhea and Kang, Kalahari, Bechuanaland [Bot].
Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Kamaggas and Steinkopf, Little Namaqualand [ RSA ].
Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Kubub, Great Namaqualand and Rooibank, Southern Hereroland [Nam]. Distribution in WSC: n/a.

Melanophora aculeata Purcell, 1908: 237
[D] [jun. syn. of
Zelotes invidus (Purcell, 1907)
]
Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Possession Island, off the coast of Great Namaqualand [Nam]; Port Nolloth, Namaqualand Division, Cape Colony [ RSA ].

Remarks: This species was synonymized with
Z. invidus
based on the female; the male described by Purcell (1908) was misidentified and belongs to
Z. fuligineus (Purcell, 1907)
.
Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Rooibank, Southern Hereroland and “Southern Hereroland” [Nam]; Severelela, Kalahari, Bechuanaland Protectorate [Bot].
Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Kamaggas, Little Namaqualand [ RSA ].
Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Kamaggas, Little Namaqualand [ RSA ].
Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Steinkopf, Little Namaqualand [ RSA ].

Remark: This species is misplaced in
Zelotes Gistl, 1848
, as it lacks a preening comb (FitzPatrick 2007).
Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Southern Hereroland, and Kubub in Great Namaqualand [Nam]; Between Khakhea and Kang, Kalahari [Bot]; Kamaggas in Little Namaqualand [ RSA ].
Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Lüderitz Bay (Angra Pequena), Great Namaqualand [Nam].
Remark: Purcell (1908) described the female of the species for the first time.

Setaphis anchoralis Purcell, 1908: 240
[D] [jun. syn. of
Zelotes scrutatus (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1872)
]
Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Lüderitz Bay (Angra Pequena), Great Namaqualand [Nam].
Distribution in WSC (correct): Canary Islands, Africa to Central Asia.

Setaphis bechuanica Purcell, 1908: 240
[D] [jun. syn. of
Zelotes scrutatus (O. Pickard-Cambridge, 1872)
]
Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Between Khakhea and Kang, Kalahari, and Bonche in the Kalahari, Bechuanaland [Bot].
Distribution in WSC (correct): Canary Islands, Africa to Central Asia.
Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Keetmanshoop, Great Namaqualand [Nam].
Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Khakhea and Kang in the Kalahari, and from between Severelela and Kooa in the Kalahari, Bechuanaland Protectorate [Bot].
Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Southern Hereroland and Otjimbingwe [Nam].
Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Kamaggas and Steinkopf, Little Namaqualand [ RSA ].
Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Kamaggas, Little Namaqualand [ RSA ]; Kubub, Great Namaqualand [Nam]. Distribution in WSC: RSA .
Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Kamaggas and Steinkopf, Little Namaqualand [ RSA ]; Lüderitz Bay, Great Namaqualand [Nam].
Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Kubub, Great Namaqualand [Nam].
Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Steinkopf, Little Namaqualand [ RSA ]; Kubub, Great Namaqualand [Nam]. Distribution in WSC: n/a.
Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Steinkopf, Little Namaqualand [ RSA ].
Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Kubub, Great Namaqualand and Cape Cross , Southern Hereroland [Nam].

Remarks: The male of
X. aridus
was described for the first time in this paper, but was later found to be mismatched to the female of the species (Tucker 1923). The new name
X. perversus Purcell, 1923
was later proposed for this male, while Tucker (1923) described the true male of
X. aridus
.
Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Steinkopf, Little Namaqualand [ RSA ].
Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Kamaggas and Steinkopf, Little Namaqualand [ RSA ].
Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Southern Hereroland [Nam].
Localities in Purcell (1908) and countries: Sekgoma, Kalahari Desert, Bechuanaland Protectorate [Bot].
